Movie about two Australian girls--Debbie (Nell Schofield) and Sue (Sue Knight)--and what happens when they become girlfriends of two surfer dudes from Broken Hill in New South Wales. Complete with the reprehensible hazards of teenaged rebellion--alcohol, sex, drugs, abortion- -and everything and nothing that those thespians Luke and Matthew like or don’t like. Frightful directing, dreadful writing, dismal music; okay cinematography.

Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming.
I could tell that the people working behind the scenes really cared about their film. They may not be professionals by trade or taste (possibly possible), but they went above and beyond to make a wonderful short film.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The townspeople form an alliance against the cat, which later turns around to bite them.
